SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To report on a patient with thalidomide-induced amenorrhea and review the literature on the effect of thalidomide on ovarian function
DESIGN: Case report and literature review
PATIENT(S): A twenty-eight-year-old woman referred for a 2-year history of amenorrhea
INTERVENTION(S): History, physical examination, laboratory evaluation of the patient, and subsequent medical therapy
Literature review performed by using OVID/Medline and PubMed search strategies
MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE(S): Diagnosis and appropriate management of thalidomide-induced amenorrhea
RESULT(S): Elevated pituitary gonadotropins, other labs normal
All known causes of hypergonadotropic amenorrhea were excluded
Although this effect appears to be reversible, the long-term effect of thalidomide on ovarian reserve is unclear
